description:
Learn the basic concepts and functions of Microsoft Word’s mail merge feature that you will need to super charge your direct mail campaigns with efficiency and creativity that gets your direct mail opened.

Build a strong foundation in Word’ mail merge feature with this tutorial for beginners.

  • Learn the correct format to save your Excel spreadsheet for importing into Word for mail merge.
  • Create a Letter that gets noticed.
  • Learn how to merge two columns in Excel to save time during the mail merge process.
  • Create envelopes that look like you hand addressed each one.
  • Add creativity to your envelopes using photos, clip art, shapes and WordArt which come standard in MS Word.
  • Learn how to quickly create 1000's of direct mail pieces.
  • A Resource Guide that includes links to Free low cost Clip Art and Photo sites.

A Powerful Skill at Your Fingertips!

Learning the fundamentals and some advanced features of mail merge puts a powerful and very useful tool at your fingertips and in your marketing arsenal. MS Word (i.e. Microsoft Office) is widely used, easy to learn, has excellent documentation, and is the foundation of any successful business.

Learning to use MS Word and its mail merge feature in today’s job market and/or for your small business is essential. Being able to learn mail merge gives you a strong background to more easily pick up other features that MS Word has to offer.

Content and Overview:

Suitable for beginning Word users, through this course of 10 lectures and a little over 1 hour of content, you’ll learn all of the mail merge fundamentals and a few advanced techniques to be able to ROCK your marketing effort! You will also establish a strong understanding of the concepts behind mail merge. Each section closes with exercises, putting your new learned skills into practical use immediately. And a quiz after each section also reinforces the key concepts which increase retention.

Starting with your client list and/or spreadsheet setup, this course will take you through sales letter setup, the envelope selection and creation process, to adding creativity to your envelope using already installed features in MS Word. You’ll establish a strong understanding of not only the mail merge feature but of how to market creatively to your prospects that will get your marketing noticed.

This course is about working smarter not harder. This course was created by a small business owner for small business owners whom are tired of working IN their businesses and want to work ON their businesses. I break down each step, screen shot by screen shot so you can follow along very easily, which increase retention.

Students completing the course will have the knowledge to put their direct mail campaign on automatic pilot. And for those who don’t currently have a direct mail campaign established, will give them the steps to take action now!

You’ll be able to work alongside the author as you work through each concept, and will gain a skill that will benefit you and your business.

What this course is not:

I do not cover items that are freely published by Udemy as these are available for free from Udemy. I present you with real evidence of what works to get views which turn into sales which turn into repeat sales.

I will not "look at your mailing" and "tell you what's wrong". I don't know your niche or your knowledge - and it would be reckless of me to advise you. You must have something (anything!) you can mail and say to your target market.

I won't teach you anything that in any way breaks Udemy's terms, rules, conditions etc, whether they are written or implied - I value my Udemy earnings too much!

This course is not backed or produced by Udemy - it's all my own work ... but the excellent Udemy staff are there to help you, too, of course!

But, if you want my personal "insider" information - you need to get this course now ... right this minute.

Click the "take this course" button, top right, now ... every hour you delay is costing you money ...

Pat Gage
title: Automating Your Direct Mail Campaign.
